text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
BeMedicationRecord Element
patient 1..1BackboneElementThe patient that has the medication
name 0..1HumanNameThe name of the patient
identifier 0..1CodeableReference()An identifier or reference to the patient defined elsewhere
recordIdentifier 0..*IdentifierAn identifier of the medication record when it needs to be exchanged or tracked
summary 0..*BackboneElementSummary section(s)
identifier 0..*IdentifierUnique business identifier for this summary
recordDate 0..1dateThe date the summary was created
lastUpdated 0..1dateThe date the summary was last updated
author 1..1Reference()The author of the summary
type 1..1CodeableConceptThe type of summary
Binding: Medication Summary types (required)
basedOn 0..*Reference()The information that this summary is basedOn
criteria 0..1AnnotationA description of the criteria for this summary
period 0..1PeriodThe period covered by this summary
treatmentLine 0..*BackboneElementEach line in the summary
identifier 0..*IdentifierUnique business identifier for this treatment line
details 0..1BackboneElementThe details of the medication
dosage 0..1DosageThe medication dosage
status 1..1codeThe medication status
type 0..1codeThe type of medication - OTC, hospital, or other
indication 0..*CodeableReference()The indication(s) for which this medication is taken
medication 1..*BackboneElementThe medication that is planned or taken
reference 0..1Reference()A reference to a medication description
code 0..1CodeableConceptThe code of the medication
class 0..*CodeableConceptThe class of the medication e.g. ATC
historyDetails 0..1BackboneElementThe details about the medication history
orders 0..*Reference()History of orders and order changes for the medication
dispenses 0..*Reference()History of dispenses of the medication
administrations 0..*Reference()History of administrations of the medication
adverseEvents 0..*Reference()History of adverse events
medicationAllergyIntolerance 0..*Reference()Known Allergies to medication

Documentation for this format

name: BeModelMedicationRecord
description: The Logical Data Model for a patient's Medication Record - with summary or details

element.short: Base for all elements
element.definition: Base definition for all elements in a resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both
